learning_outcomes.description: Explain to your peers the processes involved in the imaging chain as it relates to PET and SPECT, i.e. how radiation emitted from the body is detected externally and used to form a reconstructed image of the tracer distribution in the body.
Synthesise your knowledge of the tracer principle and molecular imaging technologies to explain how important physiological parameters are estimated.
Lead a discussion on the factors affecting the accuracy and noise properties of molecular images.

assessments.weighting: <dd>30% This assessment item is weighted at 10% per quiz, with three quizzes available to complete. </dd>

assessments.task_description: In these quizzes concepts covered in Module 1, 2, and 3 will be assessed. The online quizzes will be held upon completion of each respective module.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submission will be completed via an online quiz available on blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 1 grade for each 24 hour period from time submission is due will apply for up to 7 days. After 7 days you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: Each students will be provided a topic from Module 1 or 2. The aim of this exercise is to engage students with concepts beyond what is covered in class and relate concepts to applications. Each student will be required to make a presentation and submit it on-line.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submission of this assessment item will take place online via blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 1 grade for each 24 hour period from time submission is due will apply for up to 7 days. After 7 days you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
The final exam will be an in-person, paper-based exam. UQ Examinations will contact students directly to confirm arrangements, the student will either sit the exam at the St Lucia campus (lives within 200km radius of the campus) or will be directed to nominate an exam centre by a certain date.  

Please ensure you update your semester address in Si-net at the start of the semester.

One reminder will be sent and students who fail to nominate an exam centre and will be automatically assigned to the St Lucia campus. Late nominations will not be accepted.

A list of examination centres is listed here, but note that Exam centre availability is subject to change at short notice. 

Students enrolled internally, please refer to the course profile for Internal students for in-person examination arrangements.   


The examination is an open-book, centrally timetabled, invigilated exam on-site at UQ. Any written or printed material is permitted, any calculator permitted. You will have 10 minutes of planning time followed by 2 hours to complete the exam. You will be advised of the date and time in which to complete the examination once the examination timetable has been determined. Note that late penalties will be strictly applied as per university policy.


All modules and all topics are examinable.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.topic:
Module 1: Radiation Detection

This module contains four sub topics:
1.1 The Tracer Principle
1.2 Radioisotope production and decay
1.3 Radiation transport in tissue
1.4 Radiation detection


Learning outcomes: L01, L02
learning_activities.topic_description: Module 1: Radiation Detection This module contains four sub topics: 1.1 The Tracer Principle 1.2 Radioisotope production and decay 1.3 Radiation transport in tissue 1.4 Radiation detection

learning_activities.topic:
Module 2: SPECT and PET

This module contains four sub-topics:
2.1 SPECT instrumentation
2.2 PET instrumentation
2.3 Tomographic reconstruction 1 (analytical techniques)
2.4 Tomographic reconstruction 2 (statistical iterative techniques)


Learning outcomes: L02
learning_activities.topic_description: Module 2: SPECT and PET This module contains four sub-topics: 2.1 SPECT instrumentation 2.2 PET instrumentation 2.3 Tomographic reconstruction 1 (analytical techniques) 2.4 Tomographic reconstruction 2 (statistical iterative techniques)

learning_activities.topic:
Module 3: Quantitative Methods

This module contains three sub-ﾭtopics:
3.1 Quantitative methods in SPECT
3.2 Quantitative methods in PET
3.3 Introduction to tracer kinetic modelling


Learning outcomes: L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Module 3: Quantitative Methods This module contains three sub-ﾭtopics: 3.1 Quantitative methods in SPECT 3.2 Quantitative methods in PET 3.3 Introduction to tracer kinetic modelling
